imdb.title: Gettobakkâzu dakkanya
imdb.plot: Ban Midou and Ginji Amano, two juvenile delinquents from the Shinjuku district of Tokyo, Japan, are also known as a pair of retrievers-for-hire called the GetBackers. Both of them possess supernatural powers to aid them in their m...

episodes.title: The Initials Are 'G' (Ginji) and 'B' (Ban)
episodes.plot: Ginji and Ban take on a new case-rescue a toy kitten from a crooked policeman! The client is Natsumi Mizuki, and the kitten is her last remaining scrap of her mother.

episodes.title: Get Back the Rusted Bonds
episodes.plot: Ban and Ginji are out on the streets trying to raise money to pay off their tab at the Honky Tonk when a sickly old homeless man takes pity on them and shares his food.

episodes.title: Operation: Recover the Platinum!
episodes.plot: Ginji and Ban's new case involves recovering a box for their client. They agree on the condition that they are to receive 1/10th of the contents as payment.

episodes.title: Recovery Service vs. Transport Service
episodes.plot: While still trying to recover the box, Ginji is kidnapped. While captive, Ginji learns that Ban killed Himiko's older brother a couple of years ago.

episodes.title: Deathmatch at Sunrise: The Lightning Emperor vs. Dr. J
episodes.plot: This is the final showdown as the transport service shows up to fight for the box. Ginji wears himself out fight Dr. Jackal.

episodes.title: Get Back the Divine Melody
episodes.plot: Madoka Otowa's violin has been stolen, and she asks the Get Backers to help her get it back before her concert the next day.

episodes.title: The Animal Transformation of the Beastmaster
episodes.plot: Ban and Shido fight it out, and we see Shido's animal transformations for the first time as he goes on to battle former co-worker Kurobe after Akutsu decides to change his plans and destroy the violin and Madoka.

episodes.title: Timbre of Life, Resound!
episodes.plot: All of Akutsu's men are vanquished but the violin is still missing. Shido has ordered Madoka's dog to bring it to him as an act of anger against Ban.

episodes.title: Breach the Limitless Fortress: Operation - Recover IL
episodes.plot: Hevn calls in Ban, Ginji, Himiko, Kazuki, Shido, and Akabane to do a big job in the Limitless Fortress, recovering something called Ã'ILÃ" for a mysterious group of men.

episodes.title: The Unknown Boy, Makubex
episodes.plot: The group has been split off into pairs after the incident with the poisoned smoke. Ban and Shido are attacked by a pair of assassins.

episodes.title: Explosion! Fuchouin: School Thread Technique
episodes.plot: An imposter who studied the same martial art as Kazuki impersonates him and then attacks Himiko.

episodes.title: The New Four Kings
episodes.plot: Himiko and Hevn escape from captivity. Kazuki is found alive and treated by a pair of pharmacists. Elsewhere, an old rival of Ban's named Takuma Fudou attacks Ban and Shido.

episodes.title: The Loulan Dance Whip That Whirls in the Night
episodes.plot: Fudou is extremely angry that Makubex sent Emishi in and forced him to postpone his fight with Ban. However, Makubex has another plan for Ban and Shido.

episodes.title: Explosion! The Lightning Emperor Angry
episodes.plot: Ginji is beginning to come unglued as Akabane starts to kill more people. Ginji's powers have begun to increase as he gets angrier. When Akabane and Ginji get too close to Makubex too soon, Juubei and Kagami go to fight them.

episodes.title: Recovery Team, Rendevous!
episodes.plot: Fudou is angry at Makubex and says he will only wait 20 minutes for Makubex to get all the recovery team in place before going out to kill Ban without orders.

episodes.title: Crash! Shido vs. Emishi
episodes.plot: Emishi fights Shido in a battlefield that looks like the Grand Canyon. The organization behind the construction of the Limitless Fortress is revealed.

episodes.title: Oh My Friend... Kazuki vs. Juubei
episodes.plot: Kazuki and Juubei's battler is interspersed with scenes from their childhood friendship.

episodes.title: The Man from Babylon City
episodes.plot: Makubex stages a battle between Himiko and Kagami set against a virtual Mayan sacrificial rite.

episodes.title: Blade of Revenge: Ban vs. Fudou
episodes.plot: Ban and Fudou's showdown is once again cutshort when Ban senses that Ginji is in trouble.

episodes.title: Awakening! The Advent of the Lightning Emperor
episodes.plot: Ginji is so far gone that Natsumi and Paul can see lightning hitting the Limitless Fortress from their caf?. He's destroyed the fake Teshimine, and now injures Sakura, whom he suspects of being a fake also.

episodes.title: Attack! Virtual Corps
episodes.plot: Shido saves Ban from Fudou and tells him to go after Makubex. Meanwhile, Makubex has started up an intruder interception program which makes virtual armies go after Shido and the Akabane-Ginji team.

episodes.title: The Final Fight! Ginji vs. Makubex
episodes.plot: The recovery team tries in vain to reason with Makubex. When that doesn't work, Ginji fights him in a virtual space of Makubex's own making. Ban figures out one of the secrets of the Limitless Fortress and reveals it.

episodes.title: Get Back the Limitless Future!
episodes.plot: The atom bomb is ready, but Ban uses his Jagan on Makubex before he can push the switch. The vision Makubex sees makes him realize that he doesn't want to destroy the L.M., nor does he want to turn back time.

episodes.title: Steam Recovery: The Hot Springs Travel Diary?!
episodes.plot: Hevn gets Ginji and Ban a job recovering a stolen ring at a hot springs. In their investigation/girl-watching, the Get Backers come across Kazuki and Juubei, who are on an eye-healing mission, and Juubei slays Ginji with bad puns.

episodes.title: High School Girl vs. Recovery Service
episodes.plot: A businessman named Sasakida commissions the Get Backers to recover a briefcase that a pack of high school girls stole the night before.

episodes.title: The Man Who Lost His Past
episodes.plot: Yuuji, a man with amnesia, approaches Ginji and Ban and asks them to recover his lost memories.

episodes.title: Get Back the Arms of the Goddess!
episodes.plot: Clayman returns and hires Ginji and Ban to recover the recently-discovered arms of the Venus de Milo. Meanwhile, Hevn has hired Shido and Emishi to do a recovery.

episodes.title: Mystery Assassins: The Miroku Siblings
episodes.plot: Ginji eludes Akabane and then wanders the ship in hopes that Ban is somehow still there. While doing this, he strikes up a friendship with Yukihiko Miroku.

episodes.title: Hera and Kait
episodes.plot: Shide and Emishi rescue the half-dead Ban.Yukihiko convinces Hera and friends to let Ginji live so that they can use him as a hostage later. Hera's back story is revealed and we discover why she's taken the arms.

episodes.title: The Mission Starts! Ginji vs. Miroku
episodes.plot: Shakuryuu and Hyouko fight Emishi and Shido. Ginji fights Miroku; Ban fights Akabane. The Miroku secret is revealed.

episodes.title: Get Back the Eternal Goddess!
episodes.plot: Ban beats Akabane by tricking him. Both teams manage their recoveries, but on the way home their boat's gas tank springs a leak, and as they're throwing ballast overboard, Ginji gets carried away.

episodes.title: The Get Backers Break Up?! The Enemy Is Ban Midou!
episodes.plot: Ban and Ginji get assigned to recover a diamond. They stage a public fight and Ã'break upÃ"; then Ban pretends to go over to the bad guys to fight against Ginji when he comes for the recovery.

episodes.title: Get Back the Flame of Life!
episodes.plot: Hevn commissions Ban and Ginji to recover the blood for a little girl's transfusion. She has the rare Bombay phenotype, so it's the only blood in the country that can be given to her, and it's been stolen.

episodes.title: Children of Destiny
episodes.plot: The Get Backers and Himiko are commissioned to get back a kidnapped child and transport it to its parents. Ban is uneasy about Himiko's involvement since he doesn't think she'll keep her cool; after all, she was a kidnapped child, too.

episodes.title: Natsumi Does Her Best!
episodes.plot: An elderly lady comes into the Honky Tonk asking for help recovering the memento of a dead loved one.

episodes.title: A Recital Just for You
episodes.plot: On his way to a recital of Madoka's, Shido runs into an old enemy. Hevn is taken hostage. Luckily, the Get Backers have dirty minds that prompt them to stalk Shido and Hevn.

episodes.title: Ginji Hospitalized? It's a Hospital! Everyone Assembled
episodes.plot: Ginji falls off a building chasing a rice ball and is hospitalized. Everyone comes to pay him a visit, and chaos ensues.

episodes.title: Monkey Counterattack!
episodes.plot: Ban, Ginji, and Natsumi visit Madoka and Shido at Madoka's vacation home in the mountains, and run into the monkeys from episode 26 again. It doesn't go any better this time.

episodes.title: Farewell, My Beloved!
episodes.plot: Now Paul's past is exposed. Paul used to work as a negotiator for a thieves for hire ring. Now Paul wants Ban and Ginji to recover what was stolen from him long ago.

episodes.title: The Cost of Betrayal
episodes.plot: The "Paul's past" episode. We discover that Paul used to be a negotiator and info man for a three-person team of thieves-for-hire. However, one of his group turned betrayer, and after that he retired from the thieving world. When his other partner comes back with new data on the whereabouts of the betrayer, Paul brings Ban and Ginji on a mission to recover what was stolen from him long ago.

episodes.title: The Man Who Came Back... The Limitless Fortress, Once Again
episodes.plot: Sakura turns up bearing a wound and a message: Makubex has been kidnapped.

episodes.title: The Last of the Four Kings
episodes.plot: The GB group meets up with Juubei and Emishi at Gen's and discover that Masaki is behind the whole plot.

episodes.title: Demon of Revenge, Fudou Passes Away
episodes.plot: Ban fights a newly-armed Fudou and kills him. Kaoru escapes Himiko.

episodes.title: The Brain Trust
episodes.plot: Akabane delivers his data to the Limitless Fortress, and Ban convinces Gen to finish the project Makubex started.

episodes.title: Storm the Beltline! Ginji vs. Masaki
episodes.plot: Makubex hacks a door into Ren's VR and everyone rushes to the wounded Ginji's side. Ginji half-heals himself by sucking in electricity.

episodes.title: Fated Showdown: Ban vs. Akabane
episodes.plot: Makubex decides to erase his own data rather than pit Masaki and Ginji against each other

episodes.title: Get Backers
episodes.plot: Ginji knocks out Masaki and then Masaki confesses that this whole plot has been a desperate strategy to save Makubex.
